content: takes less time to make the soap sack but you can certainly stick with single_crochet for the whole thing there are samples of each stitch in the picture on page 1 it will start to cup after about the third row the right side should be facing you see picture below once your soap sack reaches 6 you need to make a loop to hang it from if your soap sack was laying flat you would want your last stitch to be at the top corner of the rectangle see picture on pg 4 3 spiralsoapsackbylizalvino to make the loop chain 10 then slip_stitch into the next stitch on the top of the soap sack cut the yarn about 8 long tie it off and weave in the ends fill with a bar of soap in original packaging if you plan to donate once you fill your soap sack with a new bar of soap in its original packaging it s ready to be donated local food pantries homeless shelters veteran clinics relief efforts and social service agencies are great places to donate you can also check with your local churches and schools to see if there are any families in need if you don t want to donate them yourself you can drop them off to me with or without soap in them at our farm during open hours at arrow acres farm 2021 bentz round wall nj 07719 or email me lalvino913@gmail com to set up a time to drop them off you can also mail them directly to stacy wiener the founder of s a c k s a c k po box 33 allenhurst nj 07711 ifyouhaveanyquestionsaboutthepattern pleasereachoutviainstagram @arrowacresfarmyarnorbyemaillalvino913@gmail com 4 spiralsoapsackbylizalvino
